Structs/BreakerError.html#/s:14CircuitBr.name: fastFail
Structs/BreakerError.html#/s:14CircuitBr.abstract: Circuit is open - error denoting failing fast state.

Structs/BreakerError.html#/s:14CircuitBr.name: description
Structs/BreakerError.html#/s:14CircuitBr.abstract: A textual description of the BreakerError instance containing the reason.
Indicates whether two breaker errors are the same.

Structs/BreakerError.html.name: BreakerError

Protocols/StatsProvider.html#/s:14Circui.name: addMonitor(monitor:)

Extensions/Date.html.name: Date

Enums/State.html#/s:14CircuitBreaker5Sta.name: halfopen
Enums/State.html#/s:14CircuitBreaker5Sta.abstract: The circuit is half-open, i.e. experiencing errors.

Enums/State.html#/s:14CircuitBreaker5Sta.name: closed
Enums/State.html#/s:14CircuitBreaker5Sta.abstract: The circuit is closed, i.e functioning normally.

Classes/Stats.html#/s:14CircuitBreaker5S.name: errorPercentage
Classes/Stats.html#/s:14CircuitBreaker5S.abstract: Percentage of responses that threw an error.

Classes/Stats.html#/s:14CircuitBreaker5S.name: failed
Classes/Stats.html#/s:14CircuitBreaker5S.abstract: Number of failed executions (this includes both rejected and failed responses).

Classes/Invocation.html#/s:14CircuitBrea.abstract: Marks invocation as having timed out if and only if the execution

Classes/Invocation.html#/s:14CircuitBrea.name: notifySuccess()
Classes/Invocation.html#/s:14CircuitBrea.abstract: Notifies the circuit breaker of success if a timeout has not already been triggered.

Classes/Invocation.html#/s:14CircuitBrea.name: notifyFailure(error:)
Classes/Invocation.html#/s:14CircuitBrea.abstract: Notifies the circuit breaker of failure if a timeout has not already been triggered.

Classes/CircuitBreaker.html#/s:14Circuit.name: AnyContextFunction
Classes/CircuitBreaker.html#/s:14Circuit.abstract: The context function that runs using the given arguments of generic type A.

Classes/CircuitBreaker.html#/s:14Circuit.name: AnyFallback
Classes/CircuitBreaker.html#/s:14Circuit.abstract: The fallback function that runs when the invocation fails.

Classes/CircuitBreaker.html#/s:14Circuit.name: timeout
Classes/CircuitBreaker.html#/s:14Circuit.abstract: Execution timeout for the command context, that is, the time in milliseconds that your function must

Classes/CircuitBreaker.html#/s:14Circuit.name: resetTimeout
Classes/CircuitBreaker.html#/s:14Circuit.abstract: Timeout to reset the circuit, that is, the time in milliseconds to wait before resetting the circuit

Classes/CircuitBreaker.html#/s:14Circuit.name: maxFailures
Classes/CircuitBreaker.html#/s:14Circuit.abstract: Number of failures allowed within rollingWindow before setting the circuit state to open.

Classes/CircuitBreaker.html#/s:14Circuit.name: rollingWindow
Classes/CircuitBreaker.html#/s:14Circuit.abstract: Time window in milliseconds within which the maximum number of failures must occur to trip the circuit.

Classes/CircuitBreaker.html#/s:14Circuit.name: init(name:group:timeout:resetTimeout:maxFailures:rollingWindow:bulkhead:command:fallback:)
Classes/CircuitBreaker.html#/s:14Circuit.abstract: Initializes a CircuitBreaker instance with an asyncronous context command.

Classes/CircuitBreaker.html#/s:14Circuit.name: run(commandArgs:fallbackArgs:)
Classes/CircuitBreaker.html#/s:14Circuit.abstract: Runs the circuit using the provided arguments.

Classes/CircuitBreaker.html#/s:14Circuit.name: forceHalfOpen()
Classes/CircuitBreaker.html#/s:14Circuit.abstract: Method to force the circuit half open.

Classes/CircuitBreaker.html#/s:14Circuit.abstract: Method to create a link to a StatsMonitor instance.

Classes/CircuitBreaker.html.name: CircuitBreaker
Classes/CircuitBreaker.html.abstract: CircuitBreaker enables you to use Circuit Breaker logic in your Swift applications.

Classes/Invocation.html.name: Invocation
Classes/Invocation.html.abstract: Invocation entity. A context function receives an Invocation object as its parameter.
